element.name: accessory nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne198.htm ACCESSORY NERVE]; eleventh cranial nerve, XI
element.modality: cranial motor, flexor motor, extensor motor

element.name: accessory nerve, internal
element.origin: by cranial ROOTS from the side of the medulla oblongata, from the ambiguus nucleus
element.distribution: the internal branch to the vagus and thereby to the palate, pharynx, larynx, and thoracic viscera, pharyngeal and superior laryngeal branches of the vagus, muscles of the pharynx, larynx, and soft palate

element.name: accessory nerve, external
element.origin: by spinal roots from the side of the spinal cord (from the upper three or more cervical segments), from the nucleus of accessory nerve
element.distribution: the external branch branches to the sternocleidomastoid and trapezius muscles (shoulder)

element.name: facial nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne171.htm FACIAL NERVE]; seventh cranial nerve, VII
element.origin: inferior border of pons, between olive and inferior cerebellar peduncle
element.distribution: various structures of face, head, and neck
element.modality: cranial motor, parasympathetic motor, general sensory

element.name: facial nerve, muscles of facial expression
facial nerve, temporal branch
element.distribution: muscular branches to frontal belly of occipitofrontalis, anterior/posterior auricular muscle, orbicularis oculi, corrugator supercilii; communicating branches to supraorbital nerve, lacrimal nerve

element.name: facial nerve, zygomatic branch
element.distribution: muscular branches to orbicularis oculi; communicating branch to zygomaticofacial nerve

element.name: facial nerve, buccal branch
element.distribution: superficial branches to superficial face muscles; upper deep branches to zygomaticus major, minor, levator labii superioris, levator anguli oris, levator labii superioris alaeque nasi; lower deep branches to buccinator, orbicularis oris, zygomaticus major

element.name: facial nerve, marginal mandibular branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne181.htm MARGINAL MANDIBULAR BRANCHES OF FACIAL NERVE]
element.distribution: muscular branches to risorius, depressor anguli oris, depressor labii inferioris, mentalis

element.name: facial nerve, cervical branch
element.distribution: muscular branches to platysma; communicating branch to transverse cervical nerve

element.name: facial nerve, digastric branch
element.branches: muscular branches to posterior belly of digastric, communicating branch to the glossopharyngeal nerve
element.distribution: posterior belly of digastric muscle, digastric muscle contraction elevates the hyoid bone

element.name: facial nerve, stylohyoid branch
element.distribution: supplies mid portion of the stylohyoid muscle

element.name: intermediate nerve
element.origin: the smaller root of the facial nerve, lying between the main root and the vestibulocochlear nerve; it joins the main root at, or merges with, the geniculate ganglion at the geniculum of the facial nerve
element.distribution: lacrimal, nasal, palatine, submandibular, and sublingual glands, and anterior two-thirds of tongue

element.name: chorda tympani
element.distribution: parasympathetic to submandibular ganglion to submandibular, sublingual and buccal glands; supplying the submandibular and sublingual glands and the anterior two thirds of the tongue (taste)

element.name: communicating branch of chorda tympani with lingual nerve
element.origin: terminal branch of chorda tympani joining the lingual nerve in the infratemporal fossa
element.distribution: conveys sensory fibers for taste from anterior two thirds of tongue, presynaptic parasympathetic fibers destined for submandibular ganglion for innervation of submandibular and sublingual salivary glands

element.name: petrosal nerve, greater
element.distribution: running forward from the geniculate ganglion, it joins the deep petrosal nerve of the pterygoid canal, and reaches lacrimal, nasal, and palatine glands and nasopharynx, via pterygopalatine ganglion and its branches

element.name: petrosal nerve, greater, to lacrimal gland
element.distribution: Postganglonic fibers issue from the ganglion and join the maxillary nerve to enter the zygomatic nerve and then the zygomaticotemporal branch of the zygomatic nerve. The fibers finally reach the lacrimal nerve and are distributed to the lacrimal gland where they are secretomotor to the gland and cause lacrimation.

element.name: nasopalatine nerve, parasympathetic fibers
element.distribution: carries postganglionic parasympathetic GVE fibers to nasal and palatine glands

element.name: palatine nerve, greater, parasympathetic fibers
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne226.htm GREATER PALATINE NERVE]; palatine nerve, parasympathetic fibers, anterior
element.origin: greater petrosal nerve to pterygopalatine GANGLION
element.distribution: greater palatine PSN synapse on the hard palate and regulate mucous glands located there

element.name: palatine nerves, lesser, parasympathetic fibers
element.distribution: lesser palatine nerve synapses at the soft palate and controls sparse taste receptors and mucous gland, to uvula (middle palatine), to tonsils (posterior palatine), racemose glands, and some muscular fibers (musculus uvulae)

element.name: pharyngeal nerve
element.origin: a nerve running from the posterior part of the pterygopalatine GANGLION, through the pharyngeal canal with the pharyngeal branch of the maxillary artery
element.distribution: to the mucous membrane of the nasal part of the pharynx posterior to the auditory tube, pharyngeal gland

element.name: auricular nerve, posterior
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne177.htm POSTERIOR AURICULAR NERVE]; facial nerve, occipital branch, facial nerve proper
element.distribution: posterior auricular and occipitofrontal muscles and skin of external acoustic meatus

element.name: auricular nerve, posterior, auricular branch
element.distribution: supplies the auricularis posterior and the intrinsic muscles on the cranial surface of the auricula, in some mammals these muscles can adjust the direction of the pinna (outer ear); CN X sensory from ear skin

element.name: auricular nerve, posterior, occipital branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne242.htm OCCIPITAL BRANCH OF POSTERIOR AURICULAR NERVE]
element.distribution: supplies the occipitalis muscles to move the scalp

element.name: stapedius nerve
element.distribution: stapedius muscle

element.name: trigeminal nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne128.htm TRIGEMINAL NERVE]; fifth cranial nerve, V
element.origin: emerges from the lateral surface of the pons as a MOTOR and a SENSORY ROOT, together with some intermediate fibers, fine touch to principal, crude touch and pain to spinal
element.distribution: The sensory root expands into the trigeminal ganglion, which contains the cells of origin of most of the sensory fibers, and from which the three divisions of the nerve arise
element.notes: The trigeminal nerve is sensory in supplying the face, teeth, mouth, and nasal cavity, and motor in supplying the muscles of mastication
element.modality: parasympathetic motor, cranial motor, general sensory, autonomic sensory, visceral motor

element.name: mandibular nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne156.htm MANDIBULAR NERVE]; one of three terminal divisions of the trigeminal nerve
element.distribution: passing through the foramen ovale to the infratemporal fossa, extensive distribution to muscles of mastication, skin of face, mucous membrane of mouth, and teeth
element.modality: parasympathetic motor, cranial motor, general sensory, visceral motor

element.name: buccal nerve
element.distribution: skin and mucous membrane of cheeks, gums, and perhaps the first two molars and the premolars

element.name: masseteric nerve
element.distribution: masseter muscle and temporomandibular joint, proprioception

element.name: temporal nerves, deep
element.origin: usually two in number, anterior and posterior, with a third middle one often seen, mandibular nerve
element.distribution: temporal muscles

element.name: pterygoid nerve, medial
element.distribution: medial pterygoid, tensor tympani, and tensor veli palatini muscles

element.name: nerve to tensor tympani
element.origin: mandibular nerve via nerve to medial pterygoid MUSCLE and otic GANGLION
element.distribution: tensor tympani muscle

element.name: nerve to tensor veli palatini
element.origin: mandibular nerve via nerve to medial pterygoid MUSCLE and otic GANGLION
element.distribution: tensor veli palatini muscle

element.name: mandibular nerve, posterior trunk
element.modality: parasympathetic motor, cranial motor, general sensory

element.name: auriculotemporal nerve
element.origin: by two roots from the mandibular nerve
element.distribution: parotid gland, scalp in temporal region, tympanic membrane

element.name: auricular nerves, anterior
element.distribution: supply the tragus and upper part of the auricle, skin of anterosuperior part of external ear

element.name: nerve of external acoustic meatus
element.distribution: skin lining external acoustic meatus, and tympanic membrane

element.name: auriculotemporal nerve, parotid branch
element.origin: auriculotemporal nerve passes medially to the neck of the mandible, gives off parotid branches and then turns superior
element.distribution: secretomotor fibers from tympanic plexus to the parotid gland

element.name: auriculotemporal nerve, branch to tympanic membrane
element.origin: auriculotemporal nerve comprises exclusively somatosensory fibers, which ascend to the superficial temporal region and there it supplies the supplies the auricle, external acoustic meatus, outer side of the tympanic membrane and the skin in the temporal region
element.distribution: outer side of the tympanic membrane and the skin in the temporal region

element.name: auriculotemporal nerve, branches communicating with facial nerve
element.origin: The auriculotemporal nerve then pierces the parotid fascia and enters the retromandibular region of the parotid gland; Within the parotid gland, it breaks up in a spray of branches that immediately and abruptly diverge; Anterior and posterior communicating ramus with the facial nerve
element.distribution: They provide sensory fibers for the zygomatic, buccal, and mandibular divisions of the facial nerve to the skin, convey proprioceptive impulses from orbicularis oculi

element.name: inferior alveolar nerve
element.distribution: teeth and gums of lower jaw, skin of chin and lower lip, mylohyoid muscle and anterior belly of digastric muscle

element.name: inferior alveolar nerve, dental branches
element.origin: Within the canal or in their intraosseous course the fascicles of the IAN can either unite into single or double stranded bundles as well as ramify into an ample plexus formation. These neural structures give rise to the inferior dental branches and the inferior gingival branches
element.distribution: providing sensation to the teeth and gums

element.name: inferior alveolar nerve, gingival branches
element.distribution: mandibular (lower jaw) gingiva, interteeth tissue

element.name: mental nerve
element.distribution: skin of chin, and lower lip

element.name: mylohyoid nerve
element.distribution: mylohyoid muscle, anterior belly of digastric muscle

element.name: lingual nerve
element.distribution: descending to the tongue, first medial to the mandible and then under cover of the mucous membrane of the mouth; anterior two-thirds of tongue, adjacent areas of mouth, gums, isthmus of fauces

element.name: lingual nerve, branch to isthmus of fauces
element.distribution: conveying general sensation from the oral mucosa between the oral cavity and oropharynx

element.name: lingual nerve, lingual branch
element.distribution: innervate mandibular lingual gingiva

element.name: sublingual nerve
element.distribution: visceral efferent (secretomotor) fibers to the submandibular and sublingual salivary glands and overlying mucous membrane; a branch of the lingual nerve supplying parasympathetic fibers to the sublingual gland and sensory fibers to the mucous membrane of the floor of the mouth

element.name: mandibular nerve, meningeal branch
element.distribution: supplies the dura mater, supplies mastoid cells that communicate with middle ear

element.name: maxillary nerve
element.origin: one of the three terminal divisions of the trigeminal nerve, passing through the foramen rotundum, and entering the pterygopalatine fossa, from trigeminal GANGLION
element.distribution: extensive distribution to skin of face and scalp, mucous membrane of maxillary sinus and nasal cavity, and teeth

element.name: alveolar nerves, superior, posterior branch
element.distribution: innervate the teeth of the upper jaw and the maxillary sinus, and forming the superior dental plexus, molars

element.name: branches of the pterygopalatine ganglion, sensory fibers
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne142.htm GANGLIONIC BRANCHES OF MAXILLARY NERVE],[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne153.htm PTERYGOPALATINE GANGLION]
element.distribution: Eye, lacrimal gland; Nose, nasal gland; Mouth, mucosal glands of palate and pharynx

element.name: nasopalatine nerve, sensory fibers
element.distribution: carries sensory information from the posterior inferior medial wall of the nasal cavity and anterior hard palate

element.name: palatine nerve, greater, sensory fibers
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne226.htm GREATER PALATINE NERVE]; palatine nerve, sensory fibers, anterior
element.distribution: emerges through the greater palatine foramen and supplies the palate

element.name: palatine nerves, lesser, sensory fibers
element.distribution: emerge through the lesser palatine foramen and supply the soft palate and tonsil, uvula

element.name: infraorbital nerve
element.origin: continuation of the maxillary nerve, entering the orbit through the inferior orbital fissure, and occupying in succession the infraorbital groove, canal, and foramen
element.distribution: incisor, cuspid, and premolar teeth of upper jaw, skin and conjunctiva of lower eyelid, mobile septum and skin of side of nose, mucous membrane of mouth, skin of upper lip

element.name: alveolar nerves, superior, anterior and middle branches
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne147.htm MIDDLE SUPERIOR ALVEOLAR NERVE],[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne148.htm ANTERIOR SUPERIOR ALVEOLAR NERVE]; nasodental ramus
element.distribution: innervate the teeth of the upper jaw and the maxillary sinus, and forming the superior dental plexus, incisors (anterior), premolars (middle)

element.name: infraorbital nerve, external nasal branch
element.distribution: nasal alae, inferior and lateral aspects of the nose

element.name: infraorbital nerve, inferior palpebral branch
element.distribution: supply the skin and conjunctiva of the lower eyelid, joining at the lateral angle of the orbit with the facial and zygomaticofacial nerves

element.name: internal nasal nerve
element.distribution: supply the septum, pass to skin of nasal vestibule

element.name: superior labial branch
element.distribution: skin of the upper lip

element.name: maxillary nerve, meningeal branch
element.origin: maxillary nerve directly after its origin from the semilunar ganglion, before enters the foramen rotundum
element.distribution: supplies the dura mater

element.name: zygomatic nerve
element.origin: maxillary nerve, entering the orbit through the inferior orbital fissure
element.distribution: communicates with the lacrimal nerve and supplies the skin of the temple and adjacent part of the face

element.name: ophthalmic nerve
element.origin: one of the three terminal divisions of the trigeminal nerve, trigeminal GANGLION
element.distribution: eyeball and conjunctiva, lacrimal gland and sac, nasal mucosa and frontal sinus, external nose, upper eyelid, forehead, and scalp

element.name: frontal nerve
element.origin: ophthalmic division of trigeminal nerve; enters the orbit through the superior orbital fissure
element.distribution: chiefly to the forehead and scalp, sensory innervations for the skin of the forehead, mucosa of frontal sinus, and the skin of the upper eyelid

element.name: supraorbital nerve
element.origin: continuation of frontal nerve, from ophthalmic nerve
element.distribution: leaves orbit through supraorbital notch or foramen, and supplies the skin of upper eyelid, forehead, anterior scalp (to vertex), mucosa of frontal sinus

element.name: supratrochlear nerve
element.distribution: leaves orbit at medial end of supraorbital margin and supplies the forehead and upper eyelid

element.name: lacrimal nerve
element.origin: ophthalmic division of trigeminal nerve, entering the orbit through the superior orbital fissure
element.distribution: lacrimal gland, conjunctiva, lateral commissure of eye, and skin of upper eyelid

element.name: ciliary nerves, long, sensory fibers
element.distribution: dilator muscle of pupil, uvea, cornea

element.name: ciliary nerves, short, sensory fibers
element.distribution: smooth muscle and tunics of eye

element.name: ethmoidal nerve, anterior
element.origin: continuation of nasociliary nerve, from ophthalmic nerve
element.distribution: mucosa of upper and anterior nasal septum, lateral wall of nasal cavity, skin of lower bridge and tip of nose

element.name: ethmoidal nerve, posterior
element.distribution: mucosa of posterior ethmoid cells and of sphenoidal sinus

element.name: infratrochlear nerve
element.distribution: skin of root and upper bridge of nose and lower eyelid, conjunctiva, lacrimal duct

element.name: tentorial nerve
element.origin: a branch that arises from the ophthalmic nerve close to its origin from the trigeminal ganglion
element.distribution: turning back to innervate the dura mater of the tentorium cerebelli and falx cerebri
